A mobile carrier says you won a lottery

Mobile carriers in Sri Lanka are legitimate businesses, but scammers may impersonate them to carry out scams, such as lottery scams, where victims are asked to send top-up cards for the mobile carrier.

Legitimate online sellers in Sri Lanka, such as Daraz and Ikman.lk, would not contact individuals via text message to offer them jobs they never applied for. If you receive such messages, they may be part of a scam where individuals are unknowingly used to launder money for criminal enterprises.

Tuk-tuk drivers without meters may only negotiate the fare only after the ride ends, as they do not have a meter to calculate the price based on distance traveled which means they could charge you extreme amounts for a short distance. It's advisable to agree on a fare upfront to avoid any misunderstandings or overcharging.

If you believe you were charged incorrectly, you can dispute the charge through the Uber app by selecting the trip in question and choosing the appropriate option to report an issue.
